title: namecountVingette
text: namecount package provides functionality count names filter names meet specified criteria within dataset. vignette introduces main functions provides example usage.

title: namecountVingette
text: can install development version namecount GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("stat545ubc-2023/namecount")

title: namecountVingette
text: namecount package includes following functions: countNamesUnique: Count number unique values categorical column. countStart: Count number categorical observations starting specific letter. getNamesCount: Count names fall within numerical value range. getNamesStart: Find unique variables column starting specific letter. getNamesUnique: Display unique names within categorical column.

title: namecountVingette
text: countNamesUnique function can used count number unique names found categorical column data set
code: library(namecount) library(palmerpenguins)  # Count unique species in the penguins dataset  countSpecies <- countNamesUnique(palmerpenguins::penguins, "species")  print(countSpecies) #> [1] 3

title: namecountVingette
text: countStart function can used count number observations categorical column start specified letter.
code: # For the example here we will try to count names that start with the letter 'g'  dfSample <- data.frame( fruit = c("apple", "banana", "cherry", "coconut", "dragonfruit"), numFruit = c(17, 90, 35, 49, 102))  cNameCount <- countStart(dfSample, "fruit", "g")  print(cNameCount) #> [1] 0

title: namecountVingette
text: getNamesCount can used count names specified categorical colunm fall within numerical value range.
code: # Count penguins with bill length less than 300 mm  countBills <- getNamesCount(palmerpenguins::penguins, species, bill_length_mm, 35)  print(countBills) #> [1] 9

title: namecountVingette
text: getNamesUnique function can used identify unique observation names specified column.
code: # Display unique island names from the penguins dataset  uniqueIslands <- getNamesUnique(palmerpenguins::penguins, "island")  print(uniqueIslands) #> [1] Torgersen Biscoe    Dream     #> Levels: Biscoe Dream Torgersen

title: namecountVingette
text: getNamesStart function can used retrieve names specified column start given letter.
code: # Get the names of observations from the island colunm that start with the letter 'T'  tNames <- getNamesStart(palmerpenguins::penguins, "island", "T")  print(tNames) #> [1] Torgersen #> Levels: Biscoe Dream Torgersen

title: namecountVingette
text: namecount package provides set functions working categorical data, making easier count, filter, explore unique names within datasets. looking details additional functionalities functions namecount package, refer package documentation function help pages.

title: namecountVingette
text: source penguins data set palmerpenguins R package used : Horst , Hill AP, Gorman KB (2020). palmerpenguins: Palmer Archipelago (Antarctica) penguin data. doi:10.5281/zenodo.3960218, R package version 0.1.0, https://allisonhorst.github.io/palmerpenguins/.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Bre Lambert. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Lambert B (2023). namecount: Count Names Filter Names Meet Specified Criteria. R package version 0.1.1.
code: @Manual{,   title = {namecount: Count Names and Filter Names That Meet a Specified Criteria},   author = {Bre Lambert},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.1}, }

what: Count Names and Filter Names That Meet a Specified Criteria
title: Count Names and Filter Names That Meet a Specified Criteria
text: namecount package contains 5 functions:getNamesCount, getNamesStart, getNamesUnique, countStart, countNamesUnique. functions can used count number names specified column retrieve names specified column.goal getNamesCount package provide quick easy way filter better understand data set without write long function .

title: Count Names and Filter Names That Meet a Specified Criteria
text: can install development version namecount GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("stat545ubc-2023/namecount")

title: Count Names and Filter Names That Meet a Specified Criteria
text: basic example getNamesCount function namecount package using basic data set:
code: # calling the 'namecount' package library(namecount) # basic sample data frame containing numeric and categorical columns  dfSample <- data.frame( fruit = c("apple", "banana", "cherry", "coconut", "dragonfruit"), numFruit = c(17, 90, 35, 49, 102)) # using the 'getNamesCount' function  answer1.0 <- getNamesCount(dfSample, fruit, numFruit, 50)  print(answer1.0) #> [1] 3

title: Count Names and Filter Names That Meet a Specified Criteria
text: Looking summary statistics penguins data set palmerpenguins package can see mean bill length collected data 43.92mm. Now like know many observations data set species penguins bill length mean collected. use namecount function: getNamesCount function produced number, number total species observations corresponding bill length measurement numericalValue set mean (43.92mm)
code: sumP <- summary(palmerpenguins::penguins)  print(sumP) #>       species          island    bill_length_mm  bill_depth_mm   #>  Adelie   :152   Biscoe   :168   Min.   :32.10   Min.   :13.10   #>  Chinstrap: 68   Dream    :124   1st Qu.:39.23   1st Qu.:15.60   #>  Gentoo   :124   Torgersen: 52   Median :44.45   Median :17.30   #>                                  Mean   :43.92   Mean   :17.15   #>                                  3rd Qu.:48.50   3rd Qu.:18.70   #>                                  Max.   :59.60   Max.   :21.50   #>                                  NA's   :2       NA's   :2       #>  flipper_length_mm  body_mass_g       sex           year      #>  Min.   :172.0     Min.   :2700   female:165   Min.   :2007   #>  1st Qu.:190.0     1st Qu.:3550   male  :168   1st Qu.:2007   #>  Median :197.0     Median :4050   NA's  : 11   Median :2008   #>  Mean   :200.9     Mean   :4202                Mean   :2008   #>  3rd Qu.:213.0     3rd Qu.:4750                3rd Qu.:2009   #>  Max.   :231.0     Max.   :6300                Max.   :2009   #>  NA's   :2         NA's   :2 library(namecount)  answer2.0 <- getNamesCount(palmerpenguins::penguins, species, bill_length_mm, 43.92)  print(answer2.0) #> [1] 167

title: Count Names and Filter Names That Meet a Specified Criteria

what: Count the Number of Unique Values in a Categorical Column — countNamesUnique
title: Count the Number of Unique Values in a Categorical Column — countNamesUnique
text: countNamesUnique function can used count unique categorical variables present specified column data frame.

title: Count the Number of Unique Values in a Categorical Column — countNamesUnique
code: countNamesUnique(df, categoricalCol)

title: Count the Number of Unique Values in a Categorical Column — countNamesUnique
text: df Data data frame categoricalCol column containing categorical variables.

title: Count the Number of Unique Values in a Categorical Column — countNamesUnique
text: function returns numerical output, row counts filtering.

title: Count the Number of Unique Values in a Categorical Column — countNamesUnique
code: dfSample <- data.frame( fruit = c("apple", "banana", "cherry", "coconut", "dragonfruit"), numFruit = c(17, 90, 35, 49, 102)) countNamesUnique(dfSample, fruit) #> [1] 5  countNamesUnique(palmerpenguins::penguins, species) #> [1] 3

what: Count the number of categorical observations starting with a specific letter. — countStart
title: Count the number of categorical observations starting with a specific letter. — countStart
text: function looks categorical column data set returns count categorical observations start given letter.

title: Count the number of categorical observations starting with a specific letter. — countStart
code: countStart(df, categoricalCol, letter)

title: Count the number of categorical observations starting with a specific letter. — countStart
text: df Data data frame. categoricalCol column containing categorical variables. letter letter filter starting letter categorical variables.

title: Count the number of categorical observations starting with a specific letter. — countStart
text: count categorical observations starting specified letter.

title: Count the number of categorical observations starting with a specific letter. — countStart
code: countStart(palmerpenguins::penguins, species, "G") #> [1] 124

what: Count Names That Fall Within a Numerical Value Range — getNamesCount
title: Count Names That Fall Within a Numerical Value Range — getNamesCount
text: getNamesCount function can used count number observations categorical column meet value criteria specified numerical column.

title: Count Names That Fall Within a Numerical Value Range — getNamesCount
code: getNamesCount(df, categoricalCol, numericalCol, numericalValue)

title: Count Names That Fall Within a Numerical Value Range — getNamesCount
text: df Data data frame categoricalCol column containing categorical variables. numericalCol column contain numerical values. numericalValue number numerical values column.

title: Count Names That Fall Within a Numerical Value Range — getNamesCount
text: function returns numerical output, row counts filtering.

title: Count Names That Fall Within a Numerical Value Range — getNamesCount
code: dfSample <- data.frame( fruit = c("apple", "banana", "cherry", "coconut", "dragonfruit"), numFruit = c(17, 90, 35, 49, 102)) getNamesCount(dfSample, fruit, numFruit, 50) #> [1] 3  getNamesCount(palmerpenguins::penguins, species, bill_length_mm, 43.92) #> [1] 167

what: Find Unique Variables in a Column Starting With a Specific Letter — getNamesStart
title: Find Unique Variables in a Column Starting With a Specific Letter — getNamesStart
text: getNamesStart function can used retrieve unique categorical variables present specified column starting given letter.

title: Find Unique Variables in a Column Starting With a Specific Letter — getNamesStart
code: getNamesStart(df, categoricalCol, letter)

title: Find Unique Variables in a Column Starting With a Specific Letter — getNamesStart
text: df Data data frame. categoricalCol column containing categorical variables. letter letter like search names begin categorical column.

title: Find Unique Variables in a Column Starting With a Specific Letter — getNamesStart
text: function returns categorical value name, filtering specific first letter.

title: Find Unique Variables in a Column Starting With a Specific Letter — getNamesStart
code: dfSample <- data.frame( fruit = c("apple", "banana", "cherry", "coconut", "dragonfruit"), numFruit = c(17, 90, 35, 49, 102)) getNamesStart(dfSample, "fruit", "c") #> [1] "cherry"  "coconut"  getNamesStart(palmerpenguins::penguins, "island", "T") #> [1] Torgersen #> Levels: Biscoe Dream Torgersen

what: Display all Unique Names within a Categorical Column — getNamesUnique
title: Display all Unique Names within a Categorical Column — getNamesUnique
text: getNamesUnique function can used used display unique categorical variables present specified column data frame.

title: Display all Unique Names within a Categorical Column — getNamesUnique
code: getNamesUnique(df, categoricalCol)

title: Display all Unique Names within a Categorical Column — getNamesUnique
text: df Data data frame categoricalCol column containing categorical variables.

title: Display all Unique Names within a Categorical Column — getNamesUnique
text: function returns list unique categorical variables.

title: Display all Unique Names within a Categorical Column — getNamesUnique
code: dfSample <- data.frame( fruit = c("apple", "banana", "cherry", "coconut", "dragonfruit"), numFruit = c(17, 90, 35, 49, 102)) getNamesUnique(dfSample, fruit) #> [1] "apple"       "banana"      "cherry"      "coconut"     "dragonfruit"  getNamesUnique(palmerpenguins::penguins, species) #> [1] Adelie    Gentoo    Chinstrap #> Levels: Adelie Chinstrap Gentoo
